title: Buying a House
description: Buying a house is a significant financial and emotional milestone. This guide covers the essential steps for navigating the Indian real estate market.
sentences: Determine your budget, factoring in down payment, stamp duty, registration, and other miscellaneous charges.
Ensure the property is RERA (Real Estate Regulatory Authority) registered for transparency and accountability.
Secure a pre-approved home loan to understand your eligibility and streamline the process.
Conduct thorough legal due diligence. Hire a lawyer to verify property titles, deeds, and ensure there are no legal disputes.
Location is key. Consider proximity to your workplace, schools, hospitals, and public transport.
dos: Visit the property at different times of the day to check for sunlight, noise levels, and neighborhood activity.
Read every clause of the sale agreement carefully before signing.
Get a home inspection done by a professional to check for structural issues, plumbing, and electricals.
Negotiate the price with the seller or builder.
donts: Don't exceed your budget, as it can lead to financial stress.
Don't make large cash payments as part of the deal.
Don't skip the legal verification process to save money.
Don't rely solely on the builder's promises; get everything in writing.
